page.title: 05Transport(Railway line)
page.content: The railway line which runs just east of Great Ponton is the main London to Edingburgh route.There are two bridges that it traverses in our block,and many embankments and cuttings needed to keep the track level. On June 5th.from 2.45pm. to 3.15pm. three trains passed Great Ponton.They were all Intercity 125's travelling at speeds of up to 80 mph. in this stretch.It takes one hour 18 minutes to get from London to Grantham nowadays. The trains used to call at Great Ponton, but the station closed in the 1960's as part of the Beeching cuts. The old station building is now used as a warehouse for storing equipment.
